adjust: Create a new webentity for this url
no-webentities-to-download: There is no such webentity in the corpus yet.
overview-location: The inquiry view displays the {status} list
currently-browsed-webentity-location: The currently browsed webentity is in the {status} list
confirm-forget-server: Are you sure you want to forget this server ?
export-this-server-config-text: The configuration has successfully been copied to the clipboard
corpus-list-order.name: name
no-corpus-matching-search: There is no corpus matching this name.
paste-json-config: paste below the JSON configuration of an existing Hyphe server:
depth-creation-help: Defines the maximum number of clicks to follow from the first visited page when automatically crawling a webentity that was set as IN in the corpus
default-creation-rule-help: Defines how urls will be grouped automatically as webentities by default
delete-server-confirm: Are you sure you want to destroy this server? There will be no coming back.
deleted-server-info: The server has successfully been deleted.
create-cloud-server.step0.title: Create a Hyphe server on the cloud
create-cloud-server.step0.p1: You can easily create your own Hyphe server, hosted on a cloud provider.
create-cloud-server.step0.p2: This will spare you installing and hosting the software by yourself. But this will incur server time costs to pay to the provider.
create-cloud-server.step0.p3: The creation and deployment process has been simplified. This interface will guide you in order to:
create-cloud-server.step0.p3.l1: sign up to a cloud provider (credit card required);
create-cloud-server.step0.p3.l5: use the created server and/or share it with your coworkers;
create-cloud-server.step0.p3.l6: manage the new server (stop, reboot, delete...).
create-cloud-server.step0.p4: The médialab wrote this guide to allow more people to use Hyphe. The médialab does not take any action in this fully automatized process. The only fees for the server functioning are to be paid to the cloud provider.
create-cloud-server.step1.title: 1) Create a cloud account
create-cloud-server.step1.p1: Before creating your own Hyphe server online, you first need to have an account at a cloud provider offering a "Public cloud OpenStack" service, and an OpenStack user account associated with it.
create-cloud-server.step1.p2: If you already have one among the following list of proposed cloud providers, just use it. Otherwise you'll have to create one.
create-cloud-server.step1.p2.link: Click this link to get more documentation on this topic
create-cloud-server.step1.p2.link-explan: link will open in your regular browser
create-cloud-server.step1.submit: Step 2: set up your Hyphe server
create-cloud-server.step2.title: 2) Set up your Hyphe server
create-cloud-server.step2.submit: Step 3: set up the cloud server
create-cloud-server.step2.p1: You can specify here custom Hyphe settings. The default configuration is adapted to most cases, though. No need to edit anything as long as you don't have a precise need. To get more information, please read
create-cloud-server.step2.start-pages: Which pages should Hyphe use to start a crawl?
create-cloud-server.step3.title: Set up the cloud server
create-cloud-server.step3.server-name-de: You must specify a name for your server. It will be used to recognise this server on your host's account, as well as in this application.
create-cloud-server.step3.datacenter-des: Here are the available datacenters for the selected cloud provider. To know in which city is each datacenter, please consult
create-cloud-server.step3.datacenter-pla: Please select a datacenter in the list
create-cloud-server.step3.pricing-descri: You can choose to rent a server with a capacity that fits your needs. Please be aware that a more powerful server will be more expensive. The price can also vary following the chosen datacenter (
check the prices list on your provider's website
create-cloud-server.step3.no-disk: This flavor has no disk volume by default. Please chose a disk volume to add to your server (minimum required 10Go). Fees are proportional to the disk volume amount (see the upper link to the host's prices page).
create-cloud-server.step3.error.unknown-: We cannot reach the provider's API. Please retry later.
create-cloud-server.step3.confirm-deploy: Once the server starts being deployed, you will not be able to stop it until it is fully operational. Also, your provider will probably start charge.
Are you sure you want to continue?
create-cloud-server.step3.error.default: An unknown error occured. Please try again later.
create-cloud-server.step4.title: Deploy the server
create-cloud-server.step4.deploy-hyphe: Hyphe deployment (can take more than 10 minutes)
create-cloud-server.step4.error.default: An unknown error occured. Please read the installation logs on the server to know more.
webentity-already-visited: this webentity has already been visited
webentity-never-visited: this webentity has never been visited
sidebar.inquiry-overview-help: review and curate the webentities of your inquiry
sidebar.browsed-webentity-help: inquire and annotate currently browsed webentity
webentity-card.cited-by-n-webentities: {count, plural, one {cited by 1 webentity} other {cited by {count} webentities}}
webentity-is-in-list: this webentity is in the {list} list
webentity-is-previous-in-list: this webentity used to be in the {list} list
go-to-homepage: click to browse to webentity's Homepage
apply-decisions: {count, plural, one {apply one decision} other {apply {count} decisions}}
sidebar.overview.current-webentities-lis: Choose which list of webentities you want to review
new-tab.begin-phrase: To begin your inquiry session with Hyphe Browser, you can:
new-tab.review-sentence: webentities suggested to expand your corpus
new-tab.tag-sentence: webentities already included in your corpus
new-tab.url-address-prompt: ... or directly start with a URL address:
definition.corpus: a corpus is a network of webpages, regrouped as webentities, representing the result of an inquiry into a specific issue on the web
definition.webentity: a webentity is a group of webpages defined to correspond to the presence of a specific actor on the web
definition.in: the IN webentities are those defined as relevant to the inquiry
definition.out: the OUT webentities are those defined as irrelevant to the inquiry
definition.suggestions: the SUGGESTIONS webentities are those discovered during the inquiry during browsing, or crawling operations by the hyphe server
new-tab.search-placeholder: enter a term to search with {selectedEngine}
sidebar.overview.search-a-webentity: search a webentity in the list
sidebar.overview.show-only-no-tags: Show only webentities with no tags
sidebar.overview.show-only-incomplete-ta: Show only webentities with incomplete tags
sidebar.overview.show-all-we: Show all webentities of the list
fieldnotes.placeholder: You can write comments and remarks about the currently browsed webentity here
tags.corpus-has-no-categories: The corpus has no tag categories yet
tags.add-category-help: add a new tag category for the webentities of the corpus (examples: language, type of actor,...)
server-ok: the server is healthy and running
webentity-card.move-to-undecided: move this webentity to the UNDECIDED list
webentity-card.move-to-out: exclude this webentity and move it to the OUT list
webentity-card.merge-with-current-entity: merge with the currently browsed webentity
do-not-show-again: Do not show me this message again
error.corpus-not-created-no-resource: Corpus not created. Hyphe's server is overloaded, please retry later.
error.corpus-not-started-no-resource: Corpus not started. Hyphe's server is overloaded, please retry later.
error.corpus-not-started-starting: Corpus not started. Starting corpus now…
error.existing-prefix: Warning: this prefix is already bound to another webentity (see Context)
error.loading-server: This server seems unavailable: {message}, please select another one
error.server-url-already-used: A server with this URL has already been registered
error.url-and-name-required: URL and name fields are required
error.json-null-config: The JSON configuration is not valid
error.json-not-object: The JSON configuration is not valid
error.json-invalid-json: The JSON configuration is not a valid JSON string
error.json-missing-url: The value "url" is missing in the JSON configuration
error.json-missing-name: The value "name" is missing in the JSON configuration
here-homepage: This page is the Homepage of the webentity
name: Name
server-create: Create a Hyphe server on the cloud (fees)
set-homepage: Set this webpage as the Homepage of the webentity
is-homepage: This webpage is the Homepage of the webentity
sidebar.contextual.referrers-help: Webentities containing pages which point to this webentity pages
sidebar.contextual.referrals-help: Webentities containing pages pointed by this webentity pages
sidebar.cartel.webentity-status-help: Decide whether the currently browsed webentity should be included in your corpus, excluded, or put aside as 'undecided' for further inquiry
sidebar.cartel.webentity-status-help.IN: include this webentity in the corpus and move it to the IN list
sidebar.cartel.webentity-status-help.UND: move this webentity to the UNDECIDED list
sidebar.cartel.webentity-status-help.OUT: exclude this webentity and move it to the OUT list
sidebar.cartel.webentity-name-help: Edit the name of the currently browsed webentity. It will be displayed in lists and visualizations
sidebar.cartel.known-webpages-help: Review known pages belonging to the currently browsed webentity
sidebar.cartel.linked-webentities-help: Review webentities citing or cited by the currently browsed webentity
sidebar.cartel.tags-help: Annotate the currently browsed webentity with categorized tags (this will be useful to group and visualize webentities)
sidebar.cartel.field-notes-help: Write free comments and remarks about the currently browsed webentity
stack-status.help.DISCOVERED: webentities discovered through browsing or within links from the webentities that you included in the corpus
stack-status.help.IN: webentities relevant to the inquiry, that you included in the corpus
stack-status.help.OUT: webentities irrelevant to the inquiry, that you excluded from the corpus
stack-status.help.UNDECIDED: webentities that you have put aside for further decision to put them in or out of the corpus
stack-status.no-webentities: No webentities yet in the {list} list
webentity-info-crawl-started-notificatio: Crawling this webentity has been programmed
webentity-info-crawl-canceled-notificati: Crawling this webentity has been canceled
webentity-info-merge-successful-notifica: The two webentities were successfully merged
webentity-crawl-popup-message: WARNING: Setting this webentity's status as "IN" will start crawling it. Please check before that its perimeter defined in blue above suits you.
webentity-crawl-popup-message-2: Otherwise, cancel and click on "+" to define a new webentity, then set it as "IN".
webentity-crawl-popup-message-3: Also remember to adjust the name and the Homepage of the webentity if necessary!
webentity-merge-popup-message-redirect: WARNING: The webentity "{old}" which you tried to access automatically redirected you to a webpage that belongs to another webentity "{new}".
webentity-merge-popup-message-manual: WARNING: Do you want to merge "{old}" to another webentity "{new}".
webentity-merge-popup-message-2: You can either merge these two webentities together, or ignore this message.
webentity-merge-popup-message-3: If you don't merge the webentities, you won't be able to edit the status, name or tags or the intended webentity from Hyphe-Browser, you should instead use Hyphe's special tab and look for the webentity to edit it from within Hyphe's classical web interface.
in-modale.title-in: Include this webentity in the corpus
in-modale.explanation-text-first-in: You are about to add this webentity to those of interest belonging to the corpus.
browse-create: Create a new webentity more specialized than the current one from this page
in-modale.explanation-text-first-add: You are about to create a new webentity for a selection of webpages of the currently browsed one.
in-modale.explanation-text-base: Hyphe will automatically browse its webpages in order to discover and suggest new webentities to review for inclusion, based on the hyperlinks found in this one (discovered webentities will be added to the SUGGESTIONS list).
in-modale.tooltip-step-1: The webentity will aggregate all webpages whose URL begin with this "URL prefix"
in-modale.tooltip-step-2: This is the main landing page to consider when working with this webentity. It is the one that will be displayed and loaded when visiting or visualising it
in-modale.tooltip-step-3: Choose a name for the webentity in order to easily identify it later
in-modale.title-step-4: reuse metadata from the existing webentity?
in-modale.tooltip-step-4: Choose whether tags and field notes already added to the original webentity should also be added to the new one
in-modale.confirm-modale-in: include the webentity and browse it automatically
in-modale.confirm-modale-add: create the webentity and browse it automatically
in-modale.webentity-exist: A webentity already exists in the corpus with the same URLs perimeter
browser-tab-content.disable-redirect-mes: This page is empty because it should be redirected to another one but you chose to refuse the redirection so that you can work on its metadata.
redirect-modal.title: This page requests a redirection to another one.
redirect-modal.description: The web page {originalUrl} (which belongs to webentity {originalWebentity}) wants to redirect the browser to the webpage {redirectUrl} (which belongs to webentity {redirectWebentity})
redirect-modal.step-1-title: What should we do regarding this redirection?
redirect-modal.step-2-title: What should we do with the two webentities?
redirect-modal.step-2-merge-reverse-desc: Choose which part of {webentity} ({url}) you want to merge into {originalWebentity}:
